section.title: Open Sheets
section.para: To review detailed information regarding time sheets, follow this path: CRM > Project > Time and Expense. The following screen will appear:

Open Sheets
When reviewing Time and Expense Sheets, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select to display Sheets for all Employees.
Specify Employee whose Sheets you want to display.
Transactions conducted on and after this date will be displayed.
Transactions conducted on and before this date will be displayed.
Check box to view all Open time sheets.
Check box to view all Approved time sheets.
Check box to view all Closed time sheets.
Check box to create invoice when time sheet is processed by clicking PROCESS button.
Check box to create voucher when time sheet is processed by clicking PROCESS button. This is dependent on the employee being set up as a vendor.
Check box to post employee time cost to project by clicking PROCESS button. This creates a general ledger entry for cost.

note.para: Post time only post costs for employees selected as a Contractor. This is set up on the financial tab on the employee screen. See chapter on system administration.

section.para: Top tool bar, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Opens screen for creating a new Sheet.
Closes the screen, returning you to the application desktop.

Highlight a Sheet and then select this button to Approve the Sheet. This makes the Sheet eligible for Invoicing and Vouchering. This also posts the time and expenses to the associated Projects and Tasks.

Highlight a Sheet and then select this button to Process the Sheet. Depending on the check boxes selected at the bottom of the screen this button has the ability to create and invoice, voucher or post employee time cost to the general ledger.
Highlight multiple Sheets and then select this button to consolidate the Sheets into a single invoice. Consolidation will be by customer, PO, and Project.
Runs the report associated with this screen.
Select to generate the display, using the specified parameters.

section.para: Right click on the sheet to view the following options:

listitem.para: Enables you to edit highlighted Sheet. Double-clicking on a Sheet will also bring you to the editing screen.
Highlight a Sheet and then select this button to reach a read-only view of the "Edit" screen.
Highlight a Sheet and then select this button to remove the Sheet from the list.
